Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content:
`A man with 6 sections of chain wants to link them together to make one single chain containing 29 links. The 6 sections of chain are comprised of:

-------- (8 Links)
------- (7 Links)
----- (5 Links)
---- (4 Links)
--- (3 Links)
-- (2 Links)


His blacksmith charges $0.50 for opening a chain link and $0.75 for closing a chain link.


What is the cheapest price the job can be completed for? Briefly explain how this cheapest possible price is achieved.`

`A man with 6 sections of chain wants to link them together to make one single chain containing 29 links in a row:

The 6 sections of chain are comprised of:

-------- (8 Links)
------- (7 Links)

Content: FOR 10 KMD! [SOLVED]

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content:
`You've lost your wallet :(

But perhaps you are in luck as a wallet has been submitted to the local lost & found!

Of course you'll need to prove you are the true owner of this wallet.

To prove the wallet is really yours, you confirm there are 6 bills totaling USD$63.00 in the wallet.

Also, none of the 6 bills is a USD$1.00.

To simplify, provide what are the 6 bills in your lost/found wallet?`

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: Only one (initial) answer will be accepted per user which must be posted right here in this channel.

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: Pinned a message.

Author: smk762#7640
Content:
1. Power bill = $10
2. Gas bill = $9
3. Phone bill = $8
4. Hotel bill = $10
5. A photo of someone called Bill = Priceless (also, worthless)
6: A crisp USD$100 bill

100 - (10+9+8+10) = 100 - 37 = $63

Author: smk762#7640
Content: Also, my name is Bill. its a photo of me. Gimme back my wallet.

Content:
Puzzle #4 [SOLVED]
For 10 KMD!

`We need to determine exactly how many coins are in our massive bag!

We know there is a mix of quarters (Each worth $0.25), half dollars (Each worth $0.50) and silver dollars (Each worth $1.00) in our bag.

We also know that the total dollar sum of all the coins in our bag is $700.

Lastly, we know that our bag contains the exact same number of each of the three coin denominations.

What is the number of each coin type found in our bag?`
